result.execSummary:
The defendant Ben Scott Donovan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With credit for good time.
Credit for time served.
Defendant released to Monroe County.
Court suspends court costs and surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Ben Scott Donovan appeared from jail.  Court called at 11:07 a.m.  Set for PTC.  Attorney Andrea recites the agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.   Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct. 1 with the repeater stricken.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 with the repeater stricken.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- DE sentenced to 10 days in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for good time and credit for time served
- DE to be released to Monroe County
- Court enters a civil judgment in the amount of $109.88 for restitution owed to  Fleetfarm
- Court suspends the court costs and surcharge
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference at 07-30-2015 11:00 am
